author: Special Correspondent
text:
The CPI cadre garlanding the statue of late Jeeva at Jagir Ammapalayam in Salem on Monday.- Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

The cadre of the Communist Party of India (CPI) garlanded the statue of P. Jeevanandam, popularly known as Jeeva, a prominent party leader, on his death anniversary in the city on Monday.

Led by A. Mohan, district secretary of the CPI, they garlanded the statue at Jagir Ammapalayam.

V. Rajendran, city secretary of the party; Venugopal, district president; Munusamy, district secretary of the AITUC, and P. V. Rajendran, district secretary of Tamil Nadu Kalai Ilakkiya Perumanram, spoke, recalling the yeoman services rendered by the leader. They said that Jeeva imbibed democratic spirit by participating in different progressive movements ranging from anti-colonial nationalist movement, social reformist self respect movement, besides the Communist movement.

title: Jeevanandam remembered
